intro: Lachnaea passerhoides, commonly known as the common lachnaea, is a small flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges. Its flowers are small, pinkish-white, and appear in clusters, blooming in late spring to early summer. Lachnaea passerhoides is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and historical use in traditional medicine.
